summary: An Irish youth (David Rawle) discovers that his mute sister is a selkie who must find her voice and free supernatural creatures from the spell of a Celtic goddess (Fionnula Flanagan).

reviews.content: Mesmerising, spectacular, heartwrenching. A rare gem that immerses you completely and pulls you into the screen. With astounding visual richness that puts the wonder of the natual world squarely in the spotlight along with a gripping storyline and relatable characters, this is a masterful Celtic comparison to the most favourite of Studio Ghibli creations. I was swallowed up by the story and the spectacular scenery. Utterly Briliant. I will never tire of revisiting this new classic.
It's one of my comfort films, but it could engage with it's concept so much more...

This movie proves Western animation and anime shouldn't be the only type of animation people watch. The backgrounds are lush and intricately designed, the characters are distinct, and the story is impeccable. This movie was made by an Irish animation studio, and is a much needed wake up call to the fact that we should broaden our horizons when looking for movies and shows to view, not automatically going for what we've heard is good or what was made in Japan or America. And there is no problem with anime; it is an art form unto itself, and has had an inimitable impact on pop culture as we know it. Same with Western animation. It just seems like a good idea to expand our views to places often looked over, and this movie proves that.
Song of the sea is a masterpiece of animation. I love this movie deaply because of it's my morals, story, magic, and thought put into it.
Really good! You should definitely give it a try!

Song Of The Sea is a very mystical experience. It sweeps you into a world of selkies, fairy's, giants, and owl witches and it is creative enough not the feel cliche or tedious. It's animation is breathtaking and it teaches the audience a good lesson of letting go of the past and moving on. It is guaranteed to be a future classic and a love letter to Irish culture and animation as a whole.
Pretty basic plot, but done in an amazing way. I liked how it went over both parent and children grief, as well as it isn't a straight line to healing.
Its one of the best films i have watched this year
Song of the Sea is the Perfect Tale for the Young & the Young at Heart.

Absolutely fantastic. Unique style, actually improving the accomplishments of "Secret of Kells", fascinating interpretation of the irish lore, beautiful characters, riveting story.

This movie is a gem.

After seeing Wolfwalkers, I added this film to my watchlist, as well as the fact that it was nominated for an OSCAR for Best Animated Feature in 2014.
Needless to say, I loved everything about it!
Loved it, totally beautiful amazing soundtrack.

Hmm... How can I describe this movie...AMAZING! There were funny, sad and even heartwarming moments to make this film perfect, and there some memoriable characters like Ben, Saiorse, The Macha, the F√¶ries and the Great Seanacha√≠. Great animation as usual and this is one of the greatest films in Ireland.
La animaci√≥n es sublime y la trama es muy bonita y conmovedora; la recomiendo si quieres ver una muy buena pel√≠cula animada.

Watch WOLFWALKERS instead.  Song of the Sea was visually artistic and had a nice song at the end.  But it totally lacked watchable substance.  The plot was confused and unclear.  It lacked stakes and character development.  It waved motifs/symbols but lacked meaning.  It was not well-thought out.  Not worth watching for adults.
Exceptional storytelling and breathtaking animation. Highly recommended for all lovers of visual art, mythology, and fantasy.

Plot lines, schmot lines, this is animation at its finest, with the need for full suspension of belief, except for in all things magically splendiferous in this world of Celtic lore, seaside vs. city life, and mourning. Song of the Sea is the work of director Tomm Moore, writer Will Collins, and the genius animation/visual artwork of Cartoon Saloon.
This is a phenomenally stunning work of animation artistry. The film is driven as much, if not more, by the drawing, colors and imaginative focus of the animative world they created as it is by the story itself. That story is one of a young boy, his father, and the little sister who live in the aftermath of the loss of the mother & wife. The brother learns a extraordinary fact about his sister, whom he is annoyed with and tires of as a typical young boy would. 
Once the boy learns this great secret, one new to his sister as well, he becomes driven to set things right for her as she is missing an essential part of her self, in a sense, and will perish without it. Here is where some issues of formulaic situations and some flat moments come in. There are obvious plot points and some unwanted melodrama here. But, again, the art work in the animation carries the day. 3.6 stars for me.
This is the first Irish movie I've ever seen, and I have a feeling that any other I see will have to pale in comparison to this stunning film. I loved it entirely.

One of the best animated movies I have seen! So delicately and lovingly made. The music, the songs, the animation and the voice acting all come together to create a sense of coming home. It's like a warm cup of earthy tea on a gloomy day. Comforting you, telling you it's going to be okay.

This movie was one of the best animated movies I've ever seen the story and art style mix together perfect and every character has their own development and at all a joy to see. Sorry I can't rate this higher.
Serenade beauty of the sea in the world. üëç

Currently my favorite movie of all time, Song of the Sea is a beautiful experience with gorgeous animation about despair and the survival of culture and mythology. For a children's movie, Song of the Sea takes itself very maturely and bathes it's characters in a wonderful atmosphere. There is not one single villain in this movie, every character is 3-dimensional and have their own reasons for their actions, even for characters you wouldn't expect. Genuinely a phenomenal movie that deserves way more attention than it has right now.

Great watch, would watch again, and do recommend.

The animation in this beautiful, and some of it reminds me (vaguely) of "Spirited Away", but makes more sense.  I'm sure the relation is the sense that "Spirited Away" is Miyazaki's display of the Japanese fey, though it is apparently in several other movies (e.g. "My Neighbor Totoro", "Ponyo").

This is a movie of great tragedy and powerful feelings, but ultimately is about appreciating your family and people while they are there.  There is charm and uplifting feelings to the entire situation: you're not just going to be depressed or moved.

As the introduction of the fey start, it is very unclear what is real and what is magic, or if the magic is real.  That surreal attitude to this child's adventure seemed to add to the charm of dealing with the situation.

The only problem I have with the movie is this ambiguity, there are so many parallels (that often occur in fey stories) to reality that you can't tell if this is a story of how a boy imagined an adventure, or if it's a fey story full of hidden magic.

The details they go into are amazing if you look.  Even the tears shared between fey and human are different.  The details go on, and while I'm not sure if the quality is better, worse, or just different to a Miyazaki film, I feel it was made with the same consideration for how the audience is supposed to feel as they watch in the same way he created.

This is another wonderful beautifully animated film. I really like the animation designs and the story also. The story is unique yet not really complicated, Exactly for the kids to watch. This is one chunk of Gold from Universal Studio for me.

I should probably just say up front that I often struggle with fantasy stories that focus on a lot of magical and mystical things. Song of the Sea is a film that fully embraces the world of fairies, spirits, and other magical beings. It is connected with Irish folklore, which is something I know little about, aside from the concept of selkies. Needless to say, I had a hard time getting fully invested in this story, and remained a bit checked out through the whole thing. There were also a number of logic questions that kept coming to mind, and I had to remind myself that a fantasy adventure requires some suspension of disbelief, no different than one of my superhero movies. Who knows why I can fully buy into the fact that a human being can turn into a giant green rage monster, and yet I struggle when one turns into a seal, but for some reason my brain fights against this kind of fairy tale. The plot that I cared about was the big brother trying to watch out for his little sister, and when I could overlook the mystical mumbo-jumbo, I enjoyed seeing how he grew from resenting her into genuine affection. They did a good job of building up his character in the early scenes, and you could understand the arc of his emotional journey through the film. It felt a bit like everyone else was a non-character, though. The sister does so little, and is merely a damsel in distress. The parents are not in most of the film, to the point that the villains have more of a stake in the story than them. I will say that the art style of Song of the Sea was adorable. It has a cute childlike quality to it that I enjoyed. One final thing I have to mention, the titular song was a bit overused in the film. I was starting to get tired of it by the end, and considered it annoying when the tune was stuck in my head afterwards. Clearly, Song of the Sea isn‚Äôt exactly my cup of tea, but it had some elements that I appreciated, even though I doubt I‚Äôll be watching it again.

"Wow... Beautiful.."

A beautiful Irish story about a little girl trying to save the spirit world and other magical beings. Drawings are awesome and they plot heartwarming. Great artistic movie or quality family time.
A magical blend of British isles folklore and storytelling is stunning both visually and emotionally. The art style is stunning in its own right, while the story is powerful and moving.

I think the movie was amazing.
The animation was captivating, storyline  phenomenal. And I loved the mythology that's in the story. 
I can personally say if you want something that's not to dramatic and just wanna see wacth captivating and relax, then this is a show I recommend.

One of the most visually interesting movies i've seen in a while. The story remains equally interesting troughout the whole movie. The twist was definitely expected, but somehow it still worked. This movie just works on so many levels. The characters, the visuals, the writing, ... I would recommend this movie to anyone.
An absolute must see! It's like the perfect mix between Spirited Away and Coraline which are two of my favourite movies of all time! Loved every moment of it!
Just amazing, the idea, the story line, the layout, the delivery. Everything top to bottom, top-notch. You might be drawn to a coupe tears...
A truly moving story of magical realism and it's my #1 movie of all time, I absolutely loved it and I love to watch it over and over again

Tomm Moore does it again, with a flawlessly animated film that truly feels magical.
A+
es la mejor pelicula del mundo lo que mas madoro de esta pelicula artistica es su  historia y y los personajes hechos a mano por escritores expertos lo que mas ase llorar de este film es su final
Its art, its soundtrack and its story based on celtic mythology make it a masterpiece.
Very magical and interesting
Amazing plotline and graphics. Not a movie I would pick but the mythical elements are woven in so delicately. Would recommend to most people

Visually very similar to Secret of Kells, this story is even more enchanting.
The balance between wonder, adventure and danger is perfectly suited for all ages and the end result won't leave any heart untouched!
Best storyline of all time Moore is the best aithor
Heartfelt, magical, warm story based on Irish lore, we loved it.

This is one of the best animated films ever made, hands-down. The visualizations, score, and characters are lovely and complex for animation. This is one of my favourite movies of all time and I√¢(TM)m a 30+ year old woman. It reinforces that animation isnt just for kids, and does so spectacularly. This movie, along with other factors, has convinced me to learn Irish (currently 4 months in) and move to Ireland to further my immersion. If that doesn√¢(TM)t say something about the power of cinema, I don√¢(TM)t know what does. Go raibh maith agat!
A reminder of what storytelling and animation should be
I literally made an account in order to give this movie a rating. 5 stars, one of the best movies I've ever seen, made me cry
Absolutely DELIGHTFUL fairy tale with wonderful animation/artwork!

Song of the Sea has good visuals, but the story is rather weak and forgettable. The movie spends little, if any time explaining the concepts and story elements. It seemed like the movie introduced too many new ideas too quickly and I knew from early on that they probably wouldn't be tied together in the end. Many parts of the story are literally never explained at all. I got the sense that the movie drew upon Irish legends that I guess we were already supposed to know, so the movie does you the favor of not telling you the greater context just in case you aren't familiar with Irish folktales. For most of the movie, I felt a little lost as to why things were happening the way they were or who these weird characters were. I had hope that things would come together neat and tidy in the end, but to no avail. 

One of the main words that comes to mind was "slow". It was a family movie in that it starred children, but not in that it was funny or easy to follow. I honestly wouldn't think many children would like this movie unless they were only old enough to think the animation is pretty, which it usually is. The characters weren't particularly interesting or likable. That may have been due to the lack of character development. 

Overall, I guess I'd say the movie is very subtle and understated if anything. It's pretty to look at, but the slow pacing and lack of elaboration on anything made the film a little hard to sit through, especially considering there wasn't much payoff in the end. It's kind of a family movie, but it's not really a typical kids movie despite how I can really only picture a very young child being totally in love with this movie. It's a boring, poorly explained movie with good visuals. 3/10
What a little gem of a movie this is. Glad I found it. Awesome visuals combined with a good story and Irish folklore.

A genuinely beautiful film, one that you feel you'll remember sharing with your children for years to come.  My 5 year old in particular was really enthralled in the story and we've been talking of it ever since.  I was in floods by the end, it's a really moving story managing to weave together the magical and the everyday perfectly.  Really fantastic, hugely recommended.
The movie is so beautiful it is my favorite movie and won't be topped for a long time

Beautiful film and a pleasure to watch. The artwork feels unlike anything else (in spite of the comparisons to Miyazaki's Spirited Away) with blends of beautiful colours, dreamy mandalas, and interesting perspectives, contrasting well with sweet, simple cartoon characters. The story is moving and the relationships meaningful in this wonderful journey through Irish folklore. A magical experience.
This film is refreshingly beautiful. The magic, animation style, music and use of Irish folklore. I enjoyed the story and FELT moved by it.
This is a great movie. I have watched it twice. Great both times. If you have not seen this movie. I totally recommend this movie.
I liked it bit for some reason, it got a little bit depressing half way through!
Not enough people saw this movie. beautiful while also being emotional, entertaining and terrifying.
This movie has a message of tranquility, and peace, which touches the hearts of all ages.
Beautiful story, beautiful music.
Extraordinary animation and story full of fantasy make a rare film, suitable for every age.

Tom Moore's 'The Secret of Kells' is a wonderful animated feature that really captures the spirit of something unique, and let me tell you now that he's gone right ahead and one-up'd it with 'Song Of The Sea'. Everything about the film is magical: the story, the characters, the animation and the score all work so well together that you can't help but be enchanted and moved. It really is almost a sin that this film didn't win at The Academy Awards.

Song To The Sea captures the beautiful simplicity of 2D animation which really makes you nostalgic for a time gone by. Tomm Moore's fantastical adventure is visually stunning and subtly breathtaking in its unique art style. The story is engaging for both younger audiences and adults thanks to the emotional depth of the characters. I loved watching this movie and can honestly say it earned that Oscar nomination.
Esta pelicula simplemente me robo el coraz√≥n.
Beautiful art style, endearing characters, entertaining plot. Good for all ages.

The main character is unlikable and some scenes don't make a lick of sense, but the animation is gorgeous, the music has a somber relaxing feel to it and the story as a whole is fresh, original, and entertaining. Not a great film, but one that's worth watching at least once.

Ben and his younger sister Saoirse live with their father Conor in an isolated lighthouse.  Their mother died six years ago while giving birth to Saoirse.  Unable to talk, Saoirse is starting to show special powers and sea creatures seem to respect her, indicating that she is no normal little girl.

A sweet modern-day fairy tale.  A linear adventure story that manages to stay reasonably focused and doesn't get too fantastical.  

Mostly ideal for kids though adults won't mind it either.  Quite difficult to dislike.

Not very profound though - it is just a linear fantasy story, after all.  So not brilliant, but still enjoyable.
Beautiful, fluid and lyrical. Reminds me of the illustrated books of folk and fairy tales I treasure from my childhood.

It's so pretty, that any complaints about the pacing or mythological narrative background needed to understand the story melts away.

Because at the core it's an amazingly animated story that's propped up by two strong central characters and a centralized human message at the end.

Ultimately that's all you need.
Excellent peice of work, beautiful movie, love this movie great. Art is incredibly well done as is the storyline, and music. A true keeper.
Really good movie. Really good and beautiful animation. Great soundtrack. Will see again.
One of the best animated family films I've ever seen !
I loved the film! I enjoyed its visual beauty and was deeply moved by its narrative and music.
Song of the Sea is a visual beauty in it's storytelling fantasy about emotions and seals
A more visually stunning film will not be found.
Perfect. The plot follows just like a fairy tale, winding and mysterious with a great payoff at the end. This film deserves all the kudos it get and more.
Saw this was a free movie on Amazon Prime. Emme likes it almost as much as Moana, which is high praise
Deliziosa favola in tema nordico narrata con bellissime animazioni in due dimensioni. E' una storia veramente dolce e toccante che riesce a coinvolgere adulti e bambini di qualunque et√†.

Best movie I've ever seen!!! The animation is spectacular, the characters are well developed and relatable, and the fantasy theme mixes to make a great movie!!

Pretty good movie. Beautiful artwork done for the movie! The voice acting was good and it was a very imaginative movie. But, the movie lost my attention towards the middle, because it became too fantasy-ish. It was a cute little childrens movie though

Not as good as Secret of Kells, and honestly I can't decide if it's even a good movie. It's beautiful to look at to be sure, but the characters aren't super interesting, the story makes no sense, and there just isn't too much that's great about it. I'm still hopeful that Tomm Moore will keep getting better and give us something spectacular soon.
Just beautiful, and with so much depth for a movie.
I LOVED IT! great story, and its adorable! heart melting, even for my emo friends... and we're 15!
